Abstract: Mack-Cali Realty Corp says it sold stakes in office buildings in Princeton and Parsipanny, NJ, and in Phoenix, Ariz, for more than $100 million, and bought office buildings in Moorestown, NJ, for $8 million (S)
Snippet: Mack-Cali Realty Corp says it sold stakes in office buildings in Princeton and Parsipanny, NJ, and in Phoenix, Ariz, for more than $100 million, and bought office buildings in Moorestown, NJ, for $8 million (S)
LeadParagraph: The Mack-Cali Realty Corporation, a real estate investment trust in Cranford, N.J., said late on Thursday that it had sold stakes in properties in New Jersey and Arizona for more than $100 million. The company sold a 71,000-square-foot office building in Princeton, N.J., and a 119,000-square-foot office property in Phoenix, each for about $9 million. The company said it sold a 55 percent stake in five buildings in Parsippany, N.J., for $84 million. Mack-Cali, which owns or has stakes in 257 properties, used part of the proceeds to buy three office buildings in Moorestown, N.J., for $8 million.

Headline.Main: MACK-CALI REALTY SELLS NEW JERSEY AND ARIZONA STAKES
Headline.PrintHeadline: COMPANY NEWS; MACK-CALI REALTY SELLS NEW JERSEY AND ARIZONA STAKES
